item.title: Tensor of sheaves
item.description: Following the Excersice 2.5.13 from Justin Curry's thesis we show that, in general, tensor of sheaves is not a sheaf. We begin by proving that the set of sections of a continouos function and its free vector space give a sheaf. Finally, we show that if we take $f(z)=z^2$, from $S^1$ to $S^1$, the tensor of its section vector spaces is not a sheaf. Let $f:Y\rightarrow X$ be a continouos function, for every subset $U\subset X$ we denote the set of section of $f$ on $U$ by

item.title: Cech Cohomology of Pre-Sheaves
item.description: Let \(X\) be a topological space and let \(F\) be a pre-sheaf of vector spaces on \(X\). Given an open cover \(\mathcal{U} = \{ U_i \}_{I \in \Lambda}\) of \(X\), we define the Cech Cohomology of \(F\) as the cohomology of the cochain complex \[ (C^\bullet (\mathcal{U},F), \delta^\bullet) \hspace{0.5cm} {\rm where} \hspace{0.5cm} C^p (\mathcal{U},F) = \prod\limits_{|I| = p + 1} F(U_I) \hspace{0.5cm} {\rm for}\hspace{0.5cm} I \in N(\mathcal{U}). \] where \(U_I = \cap_{i \in I} U_i\).

item.title: Help
item.description: Setup local environment: Install Git Install Hugo Execute the command: git clone https://github.com/cosheafclub/hugo-blog.git Create a post: Go to the directory hugo-blog Execute the command: hugo new posts/<post-name>.mmark Edit the file content/posts/<post-name>.mmark with your favorite text editor. Before uploading the content, try it in your computer by running the command hugo server -D. Open a web browser and go to http://localhost:1313/ Once you are happy run execute the command hugo, commit and push the repository.
